pages.text: Since our arrival in this particular world, our current squad has spent a lot of time exploring and learning its physics and mechanics.
We've learned many useful techniques to accelerate the process of building this shelter.
If anyone ever finds one of the many copies of this journal, they will probably find the place completely desolate.
We can't stay here as if nothing happened. I'm not sure if Amiya is here too... We need to make sure she's okay.
Whoever is reading this, Operator or not — if you find Amiya, please help her return safely to us.
Apparently, this world has more than one dimension. We made this discovery after Ifrit tried to set fire to an obsidian rectangle.
After the fire began to spread across the blocks, a purple spark suddenly appeared.
That spark turned into an entire layer of purple... aura? I don’t know how to describe it — it’s so strange...
Mon3tr tried to extract a sample from the portal so I could analyze it later, but it was futile...
The fact that I can't find a way to measure time is starting to become a major issue. And the sky isn't even visible in here...
We just survived a swarm of pig-looking zombies. Jessica shot one of them on instinct, and everything escalated—very quickly.
We're on our way to one of our outposts to rest. For the time being, we won’t be visiting that dimension again.
Even if it may seem unnecessary to point this out, perhaps someone will find it useful.
I've been studying the behavior of the living creatures we frequently encounter during our daily operations.
I can say with confidence that spiders and zombies are among the least dangerous creatures around here.
Even Jessica, despite being so timid, can take them down with a single shot.
Skeletons can be quite bothersome at times, especially if you don’t have anything to block their arrows—like I do, or Liskarm.
They can also ride spiders, which is quite interesting to say the least...
The main problem are those grass-looking creatures... They are the main threat here, and they don't disappear after the sun rises...
My first encounter with one of those beings is truly something I've never seen before.
Fortunately, Mon3tr is always by my side to save me whenever I'm helpless.
I finally managed to make PRTS work in this world. It's not even close to the original capacities of PRTS...
But for now, it's enough to communicate with my operators again. I'm fairly happy with the results.
I still need to recalibrate each communicator individually, so I'll start working on it right now.
Apparently, every single aspect from our world started appearing in here as well... Swire recently found a group of Originium Slugs.
I'll start measuring the time with the help of PRTS. I need to know the exact length of day and night.
...I only slept for 12 minutes, and it's already morning. It seems that time is much faster here than in our world.
A full day lasts exactly 20 minutes according to the analysis done by PRTS. This will totally ruin our sleep cycles.
PRTS started to keep count of hours as of today. It will be a bit confusing at first...
But at least, this way we can keep the 24-hour habit. Even if that implies sleeping for more than 10 "days".
We've been in this world...for a long time now, and we definitely learned a lot.
We adapted to basically every environment this world has to offer.
We finally visited that dimension again, collecting all the materials we could.
We used the newly obtained blocks to update all of the shelters design. It looks way nicer now.
The Originium managed to establish itself in here, which is concerning me.
I'm starting to wonder if someone from Reunion ended up here as well...
So far, we've traveled from an outpost to another many times without any encounters.
But I'll keep my eye out for any signs of their presence, we don't want nuisances while we try to go back home...
This is probably the last journal I write since we're running out of paper.
You, reader. We haven't found Amiya yet... We are constantly going out on expeditions to find her.
Rhodes Island is slowly reuniting, but I don't want to expose them to the possible dangers out there.
I'm not talking about the monsters, some unknown force or entity dragged us here.
Maybe I'm wrong, but I simply cannot find any other explanation for this. We all just suddenly woke up in here.
And if that force or entity decides to show up, I want to be the one to face it first. I've been in worse scenarios...
Everyone is sleeping now, it's my time to go. I'll try to collect as much info as possible and record it into a journal.
Until then, I'm certain that my operators will be able to survive on their own while I'm gone.
Or maybe... You could help them...?
